channel.title: New world of atomic energy
channel.description:
About peacetime uses of atomic energy, with experts from Oak Ridge and other atomic energy centers.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Atoms for peace
item.description: This program features a shortened version of an address by Dr. Henry DeWolf Smyth, author of "Atomic Energy for Military Purposes," given in Oak Ridge on April 30, 1955, as first foreign students arrive to study under Atoms for Peace Plan.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Atomic energy and crops
item.description: This program features the voices of Dr. C.L. Comar of Oak Ridge and Dr. N.E. Tolbert discussing potential agricultural uses of nuclear energy.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Atomic energy and industry
item.description: This program features the voices of S.R. Sapirie, Dr. Paul Aebersold, Dr. C.E. Crompton, and Dr. Ralph Overman, all of Oak Ridge.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Atomic energy and power
item.description: This program features Dr. Alvin Weinberg, interviewed by Jack Westbrook of WUOT. Weinberg is research director of the Oak Ridge National Laboratory.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Atomic energy and propulsion
item.description: This program features the voices of Frank Pace, Jr., of General Dynamics Corporation and former Secretary of the Army, and Dr. Lyle Borst, chair of the physics division of New York University.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Atomic energy and medicine
item.description: This program discusses the possible use of a new radioisotope called Yttrium 90 in treatment. Dr. Marshall Brucer, Dr. Gould Andrews, Dr. Granvil Kyker, Dr. Ralph Kniseley are featured.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Atomic energy and livestock
item.description: This program features the voices of Dr. C.L. Comar of Oak Ridge, Dr. P.P. Levine of New York State Veterinary College, Maj. Grant Kuhn of the U.S. Air Force, Lt. Col. Bernard Trumm of the U.S. Army.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Atomic energy and the future
item.description: This program includes a portion of a speech by Dr. Alvin Weinberg of Oak Ridge National Laboratory on April 30, 1955; Frank Pace, Jr., of General Dynamics Corp. on Hundred Year Plan, Prof. L.W. Nordheim, Dr. M. Brucer are also heard.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Introduction
item.description: This program features the voices of Professor Arthur Compton, Dr. Paul Aebersold, Dr. Clarence Larsen, Dr. R. A. Charpie, all of Oak Ridge.
item.dc:creator: Gouds, Moyra
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century
